comment.body: There's an ongoing [Grid RFC](https://github.com/Shopify/ui-api-design/discussions/185) that would be a good place to share these opinions. Since grid has been marked as stable we don't want to make any rash changes to it without knowing the APIs of other Grid components

issue.title: [Button and Link quality] [Milestone 1] Update existing `Link` instances in `web` and bump to polaris version with `Link` updates
[Button and Link quality] [Milestone 1] Create list of context where underline `Link` is used
Make the hoverability of the rows in `<IndexTable.Row>` optional?
issue.body:
## Feature request summary

Add a prop called "hoverable" to the `<IndexTable.Row/>` component that defaults to true and toggles on or off the hover CSS for said component.

I am happy to submit a PR to add a "hoverable" property to the `<IndexTable.Row/>` component if this is okay.

## Rationale

When data in the Index Table is not selectable, the hover class on the `<IndexTable.Row/>` component still fires, so it kind of feels like you should be able to click on the rows, but clicking won't achieve anything.

Allowing that to be toggled off will make the UX for non-selectable IndexTables better.

issue.title: [polaris.shopify.com] Props table feedback
issue.body:
Not a fan of this default Props view (_folded/hidden_)
eg- https://polaris.shopify.com/components/selection-and-input/text-field#props
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1505013/228386462-b85fd99a-1406-4e93-ac6b-1250ef0e672b.png)

Personally,
- it was too easy to glance over those links
- not obvious they were links.
- other components do not require toggling this.

**Recommendation:**
If anything the example and component's Props should be front and center of the documentation. If it does not parse well, it's better to default to showing it.

issue.title: Please Document Token Usage
issue.body:
## Feature request summary

Forgive me if this is documented elsewhere or there is a fundamental misunderstanding on my part.

I am unclear what the purpose of tokens are in Polaris, or how one would use them.

https://polaris.shopify.com/tokens 

Are these intended to be used on components? Are they CSS variables? Are they guidelines for non-react based Shopify apps that still want to adhere to Shopify's design principles?

Clarification on this would be appreciated, thanks!

issue.title: Audit usage of focus ring across components
issue.body:
Refs: #7585

The focus rings purpose is to show when users are keyboard navigating. It is showing up on multiple components without the users using their keyboard.

Audit the components and remove the focus ring unless the element receives keyboard input.

Example with ActionList:
![Screenshot 2022-11-01 at 7 50 09 AM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19199063/199262594-b1e74951-7b6b-48ba-a785-d383e0aaf977.png)

issue.title: Suggestion in Polaris Text field is buggy
issue.body: ## Issue summary * When you click on the middle of the text after pressing `Tab` in a suggestion it renders the clicked text like a suggestion ## Expected behavior * Nothing should happen when you click in the middle of the text * Also pressing `tab` should accept the suggestion ## Actual behavior https://codesandbox.io/s/sad-swirles-twk9r2 ## Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Type a long text and wait for the suggestion 2. Press tab 3. Now click in the middle of the suggestion ## Reduced test case mlq0m26) is a great starting point. ## Specifications - Are you using the React components? (Y/N): Y - Polaris version number: Polaris V12 - Browser: - Device: - Operating System:

comment.body: Suggestion color in multi-line field is also broken

issue.title: [Prototype DO NOT MERGE] 11044/documentation components
issue.body:
### WHY are these changes introduced? Fixes #11044 ### WHAT is this pull request doing? - add responsive colStart prop to Grid.Cell - `Docs` Add new layout blocks for content authoring - `Docs` refactor using-color to use the new layout primitives as a POC ### How to 🎩 🖥 [Local development instructions](https://github.com/Shopify/polaris/blob/main/README.md#local-development) 🗒 [General tophatting guidelines](https://github.com/Shopify/polaris/blob/main/documentation/Tophatting.md) 📄 [Changelog guidelines](https://github.com/Shopify/polaris/blob/main/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#changelog)
Copy-paste this code in playground/Playground.tsx: ```jsx import React from 'react'; import {Page} from '../src'; export function Playground() { return ( {/* Add the code you want to test in here */} ); } ```
### 🎩 checklist - [ ] Tested on [mobile](https://github.com/Shopify/polaris/blob/main/documentation/Tophatting.md#cross-browser-testing) - [ ] Tested on [multiple browsers](https://help.shopify.com/en/manual/shopify-admin/supported-browsers) - [ ] Tested for [accessibility](https://github.com/Shopify/polaris/blob/main/documentation/Accessibility%20testing.md) - [ ] Updated the component's `README.md` with documentation changes - [ ] [Tophatted documentation](https://github.com/Shopify/polaris/blob/main/documentation/Tophatting%20documentation.md) changes in the style guide

comment.body:
This PR includes changes to `Grid.Cell` in `@shopify/polaris-react`, our solution here relies on being able to configure `grid-column-start` to conditionally horizontally offset our mdx layout primitives. 

For this solution to be mergeable into `main` we need to either: 
* Agree on and ship this change to the Grid component in @shopify/polaris (minor patch) 
* Find a solution that is comparable and doesn't involve this additional functionality. 

Personally I'm a proponent of our layout primitives letting us use the browser API with minimal / no guardrails, but I recognise that there's context here (especially around a11y) that I may not have. cc @kyledurand  @jesstelford

comment.body:
```suggestion
Consolidate `Button` boolean props to `variant` and `tone`. The `Button` component has been updated to replace deprecated `connectedDisclosure`, `outline`, `destructive`, `primary`, `primarySuccess`, `plain`, and `monochrome` props with a new `variant` prop that supports multiple variation options.
```

issue.title: Require action icon
issue.body:
## Feature request summary


In need a new icon that will represent "Payment pending" in the Orders Task Card. In working with Operate team @travis-eh @jeffkraemer2 we decided a new icon was necessary.


## Rationale


This icon will represent a filtered list of orders that required an action before they can receive their payout. I have 2 proposals.
1. Hand with joy sparks
2. Hand with money symbol

Joy sparks are a bit more abstract versus the money symbol.
![Screenshot 2023-10-16 at 12 51 13 PM](https://github.com/Shopify/polaris/assets/97758241/4a1adeee-69e8-4f8d-bd31-a631127f524d)
![Admin-home](https://github.com/Shopify/polaris/assets/97758241/12a75b23-7bd1-4a1c-9d4d-df839adfe510)
[Figma icon](https://www.figma.com/file/2HrCq3M47Pva0ogIwJWMZX/Improve-clarity-of-Markets-Pro-payouts?type=design&node-id=2048%3A58681&mode=design&t=eIh4Z9VYuItg0VHH-1)
[Figma admin page](https://www.figma.com/file/2HrCq3M47Pva0ogIwJWMZX/Improve-clarity-of-Markets-Pro-payouts?type=design&node-id=1080%3A192098&mode=design&t=eIh4Z9VYuItg0VHH-1)


---

🌟 Feature requests that are not yet planned will be closed. We then use the issue’s :+1: upvotes to track and set priorities. See the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/Shopify/polaris/blob/main/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md) for more information.

pull_request.title: [TextField] Prevent onBlur from triggering when clicking between child components (spinner and input)
pull_request.body:
### WHY are these changes introduced? Fixes https://github.com/Shopify/polaris/issues/10948 ### WHAT is this pull request doing? Prevent `onBlur` in TextField from triggering when moving focus between the `` and `` child elements within a `` ### How to 🎩 [Spin HQ](https://web-polaris-text-field.zak-lee.us.spin.dev/) - `web` checked out on [ZL/quantity-price-break-minimum-quantity-fix](https://github.com/Shopify/web/pull/100618) - `polaris` checked out on this PR's branch (ZL/text-field-blur) Tophat steps: - Observe the buggy behavior here: https://github.com/Shopify/polaris/assets/4310197/f298a261-76ca-452b-b9f0-984d789bcd26 - Go to the [CatalogEditor](https://admin.web.web-polaris-text-field.zak-lee.us.spin.dev/store/shop1/catalogs/9/editor) for a given Catalog - Open the QuantitySettingsModal by hovering over a row in the table and clicking in the column underneath "Quantity rules" - Test against the behavior in the buggy video linked above - note: the expected `onBlur` behavior that should occur when manipulating the "Increment" TextField: - "Minimum" value "snaps" (adjusts) to match the minimum behavior - any relevant "snap" messages should appear below - verify that subsequent increases to the "Increment" value via the `` does not trigger `onBlur` logic to occur UNTIL the user blurs off of the entire TextField component - verify that changes to "Increment" TextField value via the `` does not trigger `onBlur` logic to occur UNTIL the user blurs off the entire TextField component - e.g. set input value to "5", then, without blurring off the "Increment" TextField, click the up arrow to bump the value to "6". this should not trigger any `onBlur` logic 🖥 [Local development instructions](https://github.com/Shopify/polaris/blob/main/README.md#local-development) 🗒 [General tophatting guidelines](https://github.com/Shopify/polaris/blob/main/documentation/Tophatting.md) 📄 [Changelog guidelines](https://github.com/Shopify/polaris/blob/main/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#changelog)
Copy-paste this code in playground/Playground.tsx: ```jsx import React from 'react'; import {Page} from '../src'; export function Playground() { return ( {/* Add the code you want to test in here */} ); } ```
### 🎩 checklist - [ ] Tested on [mobile](https://github.com/Shopify/polaris/blob/main/documentation/Tophatting.md#cross-browser-testing) - [x] Tested on [multiple browsers](https://help.shopify.com/en/manual/shopify-admin/supported-browsers) - [ ] Tested for [accessibility](https://github.com/Shopify/polaris/blob/main/documentation/Accessibility%20testing.md) - [ ] Updated the component's `README.md` with documentation changes - [ ] [Tophatted documentation](https://github.com/Shopify/polaris/blob/main/documentation/Tophatting%20documentation.md) changes in the style guide

issue.title: Content authoring abstraction
issue.body:
## Why 
At the moment authoring design content is difficult and error prone.
We want to land at an abstraction that makes this process **fast** and **easy** for content authors. 

@tjonx and @zecarlostorre have provided strong and good design boundaries for how content can be [laid out](https://www.figma.com/file/vO0wToyBpYjeIwr8doAAWT/Uplift-polaris.shopify.com?type=design&node-id=1804-32995&mode=design&t=TIOTeGhOE6DsGZEk-4) 

Our goal is to implement an abstraction that allows content authors to lean into these strong design boundaries while: 
a) Not having to worry about layout implementation and browser behaviour 
b) Not having to learn and memorise too much magic incantations 
c) Not have to unlearn learned behaviour from the underlying technology (Markdown) 

## What 
The present solution that we've arrived at is an abstraction on top of the browsers [grid](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/grid) spec, specifically `[grid-template-areas](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/grid-template-areas)` and their ability to allow users to declare semantic areas where elements can be laid out.

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,5 @@
+---
+'@shopify/polaris': patch
+---
+
+Improving onBlur behavior for TextField component

Fixed `TextField` blurring when interacting with the `Spinner` buttons

pull_request.body:
### WHY are these changes introduced? Fixes https://github.com/Shopify/polaris/issues/10948 ### WHAT is this pull request doing? Prevent `onBlur` in TextField from triggering when moving focus between the `` and `` child elements within a `` ### How to 🎩 [Spin HQ](https://web-polaris-text-field.zak-lee.us.spin.dev/) - `web` checked out on [ZL/quantity-price-break-minimum-quantity-fix](https://github.com/Shopify/web/pull/100618) - `polaris` checked out on this PR's branch (ZL/text-field-blur) Tophat steps: - Observe the buggy behavior here: https://github.com/Shopify/polaris/assets/4310197/f298a261-76ca-452b-b9f0-984d789bcd26 - Go to the [CatalogEditor](https://admin.web.web-polaris-text-field.zak-lee.us.spin.dev/store/shop1/catalogs/9/editor) for a given Catalog - Open the QuantitySettingsModal by hovering over a row in the table and clicking in the column underneath "Quantity rules" - Test against the behavior in the buggy video linked above - note: the expected `onBlur` behavior that should occur when manipulating the "Increment" TextField: - "Minimum" value "snaps" (adjusts) to match the minimum behavior - any relevant "snap" messages should appear below - verify that subsequent increases to the "Increment" value via the `` does not trigger `onBlur` logic to occur UNTIL the user blurs off of the entire TextField component - verify that changes to "Increment" TextField value via the `` does not trigger `onBlur` logic to occur UNTIL the user blurs off the entire TextField component - e.g. set input value to "5", then, without blurring off the "Increment" TextField, click the up arrow to bump the value to "6". this should not trigger any `onBlur` logic 🖥 [Local development instructions](https://github.com/Shopify/polaris/blob/main/README.md#local-development) 🗒 [General tophatting guidelines](https://github.com/Shopify/polaris/blob/main/documentation/Tophatting.md) 📄 [Changelog guidelines](https://github.com/Shopify/polaris/blob/main/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#changelog)
Copy-paste this code in playground/Playground.tsx: ```jsx import React from 'react'; import {Page} from '../src'; export function Playground() { return ( {/* Add the code you want to test in here */} ); } ```
### 🎩 checklist - [ ] Tested on [mobile](https://github.com/Shopify/polaris/blob/main/documentation/Tophatting.md#cross-browser-testing) - [x] Tested on [multiple browsers](https://help.shopify.com/en/manual/shopify-admin/supported-browsers) - [ ] Tested for [accessibility](https://github.com/Shopify/polaris/blob/main/documentation/Accessibility%20testing.md) - [ ] Updated the component's `README.md` with documentation changes - [ ] [Tophatted documentation](https://github.com/Shopify/polaris/blob/main/documentation/Tophatting%20documentation.md) changes in the style guide
